meanings.definition: To cause (a wine or other alcoholic drink) to develop a flavor resembling that of Madeira.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the wine exposed to air can maderize it, giving it a unique taste.
meanings.sent2: Winemakers intentionally maderize some wines to enhance their richness.
meanings.sent3: The wine decided to maderize itself after a long day in the cellar.
meanings.sent4: The aging process can slowly maderize the wine, transforming its flavor profile.
meanings.sent5: The warm sun seemed to maderize the wine, infusing it with a nutty aroma.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the wine will maderize and develop a Madeira-like taste.
meanings.sent2: If stored improperly, the wine may maderize and lose its original characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The wine was surprised to maderize so quickly in the warm cellar.
meanings.sent4: As the wine continued to age, it started to maderize, changing in flavor.
meanings.sent5: The wine seemed to maderize overnight, surprising the sommelier with its new taste.
